Weak Host Key Algorithm(s) (SSH).Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak host key algorithm(s).
Weak Host Key Algorithm(s) (SSH).Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak host key algorithm(s):

host key algorithm | Description
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ssh-dss            | Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA) / Digital Signature Standard (DSS)
Weak Host Key Algorithm(s) (SSH).Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak host key algorithm(s).

Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak KEX algorithm(s) - 1024-bit MODP group / prime KEX algorithms: Alternatively use elliptic-curve Diffie-Hellmann in general, e.g. Curve 25519.
Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak KEX algorithm(s):

KEX algorithm              | Reason
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 | Using Oakley Group 2 (a 1024-bit MODP group) and SHA-1
Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak key exchange (KEX) algorithm(s).

Sensitive File Disclosure (HTTP).Solucion:
Mitigation 
	The sensitive files shouldn't be accessible via a web server. Restrict access to it or remove it completely.
Sensitive File Disclosure (HTTP).Resultado:
The following files containing sensitive information were identified:

Description: esmtp configuration file containing a username and password
Match:                       username = $('input#login-username').textbox('getValue');
Used regex:  ^\s*username\s*=.+
Extra match:                 password = $('input#login-password').password('getValue');
Used regex:  ^\s*password\s*=.+
URL:         http://192.168.1.43/.esmtprc
Sensitive File Disclosure (HTTP).Resumen: The script attempts to identify files containing sensitive data at the remote web server like e.g.: - software (Blog, CMS) configuration or log files - web / application server configuration / password files (.htaccess, .htpasswd, web.config, web.xml, ...) - database backup files - SSH or SSL/TLS Private-Keys

TP-Link File Disclosure Vulnerability.Solucion:
WillNotFix 
	No known solution was made available for at least one year since the disclosure of this vulnerability. Likely none will be provided anymore. General solution options are to upgrade to a newer release, disable respective features, remove the product or replace the product by another one.
TP-Link File Disclosure Vulnerability.Resultado: It was possible to download the backup file 'config.bin' which may contain the admin password.
TP-Link File Disclosure Vulnerability.Resumen: Multiple TP-Link devices are prone to a file disclosure vulnerability where an unauthenticated attacker may obtain the configuration backup file which may contain sensitive data (e.g. admin password) which could lead to complete compromise of the device.

Missing `httpOnly` Cookie Attribute.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Set the 'httpOnly' attribute for any session cookie.
Missing `httpOnly` Cookie Attribute.Resultado:
The cookies:

Set-Cookie: COOKIE=4601a8c008625803; PATH=/; MAXAGE=***replaced***; VERSION=1

are missing the "httpOnly" attribute.
Missing `httpOnly` Cookie Attribute.Resumen: The application is missing the 'httpOnly' cookie attribute

Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak encryption algorithm(s).
Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak client-to-server encryption algorithm(s):

3des-cbc
aes128-cbc
aes256-cbc
twofish-cbc
twofish128-cbc
twofish256-cbc


The remote SSH server supports the following weak server-to-client encryption algorithm(s):

3des-cbc
aes128-cbc
aes256-cbc
twofish-cbc
twofish128-cbc
twofish256-cbc
Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak encryption algorithm(s).

TCP timestamps.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	To disable TCP timestamps on linux add the line 'net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps = 0' to /etc/sysctl.conf. Execute 'sysctl -p' to apply the settings at runtime. To disable TCP timestamps on Windows execute 'netsh int tcp set global timestamps=disabled' Starting with Windows Server 2008 and Vista, the timestamp can not be completely disabled. The default behavior of the TCP/IP stack on this Systems is to not use the Timestamp options when initiating TCP connections, but use them if the TCP peer that is initiating communication includes them in their synchronize (SYN) segment. See the references for more information.
TCP timestamps.Resultado:
It was detected that the host implements RFC1323/RFC7323.

The following timestamps were retrieved with a delay of 1 seconds in-between:
Packet 1: 137606997
Packet 2: 137607271
TCP timestamps.Resumen: The remote host implements TCP timestamps and therefore allows to compute the uptime.

Weak MAC Algorithm(s) Supported (SSH).Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak MAC algorithm(s).
Weak MAC Algorithm(s) Supported (SSH).Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak client-to-server MAC algorithm(s):

hmac-md5
hmac-sha1-96


The remote SSH server supports the following weak server-to-client MAC algorithm(s):

hmac-md5
hmac-sha1-96
Weak MAC Algorithm(s) Supported (SSH).Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak MAC algorithm(s).

jQuery < 1.9.0 XSS Vulnerability.Solucion:
Vendor fix 
	Update to version 1.9.0 or later.
jQuery < 1.9.0 XSS Vulnerability.Resultado:
Installed version: 1.6.3
Fixed version:     1.9.0
Installation
path / port:       /mhs/js
jQuery < 1.9.0 XSS Vulnerability.Resumen: jQuery is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks.

SSL/TLS: Deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 Prot.Nombre de la vulnerabilidad: SSL/TLS: Deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 Protocol Detection
SSL/TLS: Deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 Prot.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	It is recommended to disable the deprecated SSLv2 and/or SSLv3 protocols in favor of the TLSv1.2+ protocols. Please see the references for more information.
SSL/TLS: Deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 Prot.Resultado: In addition to TLSv1.0+ the service is also providing the deprecated SSLv3 protocol and supports one or more ciphers. Those supported ciphers can be found in the 'SSL/TLS: Report Supported Cipher Suites' (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.802067) VT.
SSL/TLS: Deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 Prot.Resumen: It was possible to detect the usage of the deprecated SSLv2 and/or SSLv3 protocol on this system.

Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak KEX algorithm(s) - 1024-bit MODP group / prime KEX algorithms: Alternatively use elliptic-curve Diffie-Hellmann in general, e.g. Curve 25519.
Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak KEX algorithm(s):

KEX algorithm              | Reason
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 | Using Oakley Group 2 (a 1024-bit MODP group) and SHA-1
Weak Key Exchange (KEX) Algorithm(s) Sup.Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak key exchange (KEX) algorithm(s).

Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Info.Nombre de la vulnerabilidad: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information via HTTP
Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Info.Solucion:
Workaround 
	Enforce the transmission of sensitive data via an encrypted SSL/TLS connection. Additionally make sure the host / application is redirecting all users to the secured SSL/TLS connection before allowing to input sensitive data into the mentioned functions.
Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Info.Resultado:
The following input fields where identified (URL:input name):

http://192.168.1.1/:pass
Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Info.Resumen: The host / application transmits sensitive information (username, passwords) in cleartext via HTTP.

Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Disable the reported weak encryption algorithm(s).
Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Resultado:
The remote SSH server supports the following weak client-to-server encryption algorithm(s):

3des-cbc
aes256-cbc


The remote SSH server supports the following weak server-to-client encryption algorithm(s):

3des-cbc
aes256-cbc
Weak Encryption Algorithm(s) Supported (.Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak encryption algorithm(s).

SSL/TLS: Deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1.Nombre de la vulnerabilidad: SSL/TLS: Deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1 Protocol Detection
SSL/TLS: Deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	It is recommended to disable the deprecated TLSv1.0 and/or TLSv1.1 protocols in favor of the TLSv1.2+ protocols. Please see the references for more information.
SSL/TLS: Deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1.Resultado: In addition to TLSv1.2+ the service is also providing the deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1 protocols and supports one or more ciphers. Those supported ciphers can be found in the 'SSL/TLS: Report Supported Cipher Suites' (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.802067) VT.
SSL/TLS: Deprecated TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1.Resumen: It was possible to detect the usage of the deprecated TLSv1.0 and/or TLSv1.1 protocol on this system.

SSL/TLS: Certificate Signed Using A Weak.Nombre de la vulnerabilidad: SSL/TLS: Certificate Signed Using A Weak Signature Algorithm
SSL/TLS: Certificate Signed Using A Weak.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	Servers that use SSL/TLS certificates signed with a weak SHA-1, MD5, MD4 or MD2 hashing algorithm will need to obtain new SHA-2 signed SSL/TLS certificates to avoid web browser SSL/TLS certificate warnings.
SSL/TLS: Certificate Signed Using A Weak.Resultado:
The following certificates are part of the certificate chain but using insecure signature algorithms:

Subject:              CN=CA Telefonica Moviles Espana SA,O=Grupo Telefonica,L=PZ. DE LA INDEPENDENCIA 6 28001 MADRID,ST=A78923125,C=PL
Signature Algorithm:  sha1WithRSAEncryption
SSL/TLS: Certificate Signed Using A Weak.Resumen: The remote service is using a SSL/TLS certificate in the certificate chain that has been signed using a cryptographically weak hashing algorithm.

Weak MAC Algorithm(s) Supported (SSH).Resumen: The remote SSH server is configured to allow / support weak MAC algorithm(s).

TCP timestamps.Solucion:
Mitigation 
	To disable TCP timestamps on linux add the line 'net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps = 0' to /etc/sysctl.conf. Execute 'sysctl -p' to apply the settings at runtime. To disable TCP timestamps on Windows execute 'netsh int tcp set global timestamps=disabled' Starting with Windows Server 2008 and Vista, the timestamp can not be completely disabled. The default behavior of the TCP/IP stack on this Systems is to not use the Timestamp options when initiating TCP connections, but use them if the TCP peer that is initiating communication includes them in their synchronize (SYN) segment. See the references for more information.
TCP timestamps.Resultado:
It was detected that the host implements RFC1323/RFC7323.

The following timestamps were retrieved with a delay of 1 seconds in-between:
Packet 1: 625487826
Packet 2: 625488898
TCP timestamps.Resumen: The remote host implements TCP timestamps and therefore allows to compute the uptime.
